What did early homesteaders find out?

A QUESTIONNAIRE

Instructions: Fill in as much of this questionnaire as you can and mail it to Saskatchewan Archives Office, Box 100, University of Saskatchewan, Saskatoon, Sask.

Name ... Albert Hoverson ...
Address ... P.A.R.G.A.A ...
Birthplace ... Ontario ...

1. INTRODUCTORY QUESTIONS

What year did you start housekeeping in Western Canada? ... 1896 ...
Where did you set up housekeeping? ... Caron, Sask.
Where had you been living before that? ... In Village of Caron
For how many people did you prepare meals? ... 5 ...
How far was it to your nearest store? ... 20 miles ...
How often could a visit be made to the store? ... Twice a month ...
What groceries did you usually buy in those earliest years?

Flour, Sugar, Tea, Prunes, Beans, Dried Apples

2. FLOUR AND OTHER GRAIN PRODUCTS

What brand of white flour did you use in the early years? ... Ogilvie ...
In what quantities did you buy it? ... half ton ...
What was the usual price per hundred pounds of white flour? ... Don't remember ...
How much did you use Graham flour? ... Yes ...
Whole wheat flour? ... No ...
Was flour milled locally? ... Yes ...
How far away? ... 60 mi., what year? ... 1896 ...
What was the price for a twenty pound bag of rolled oats? ... about 25 cents ...
What other grain products did you use?
Cornmeal? ... No ...
Whole wheat? ... Used some ...
Farina? ... No ...
Other? ... None ...
Did you grind your own wheat for porridge? ... Yes ...
How did you grind it? ... With roller shaper ...
